title: 108_hr5261
content: The "Mailing Support to Troops Act of 2004" grants free mailing privileges to troops. Chapter 34 of title 39, United States Code, is amended to allow free postage for personal correspondence and parcels sent by family members to members of the Armed Forces serving in Iraq or Afghanistan. The mail must be addressed to a member of the Armed Forces on active duty in Iraq or Afghanistan, or hospitalized due to a service-related disease or injury. The mail must be addressed to a member of the Armed Forces on active duty in Iraq or Afghanistan, or hospitalized due to a service-related disease or injury. The free mailing privilege applies to letter mail, sound- or video-recorded communications, and parcels within specified size limits. The mail must be addressed to a member of the Armed Forces on active duty in Iraq or Afghanistan, or hospitalized due to a service-related disease or injury. The free mailing privilege applies to letter mail, sound- or video-recorded communications, and parcels within specified size limits. Mail matter under this section must be sent by the most economical means practicable and bear the specified marking in the address area. The Postal Service, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense, will prescribe regulations within 30 days of enactment. The free mailing privilege applies for one year. The section applies to mail matter sent during the 1-year period after the regulations under subsection (e) take effect. SEC. 3. FUNDING. Sections 2401(c) and 3627 of title 39, United States Code, are amended to authorize appropriations for air transportation expenses incurred by the Postal Service for mail sent to members of the Armed Forces free of postage. The amendment to title 39, United States Code, adjusts postage rates for mail not addressed to an Armed Forces post office and prevents duplicative funding for transportation expenses incurred by the Postal Service. SEC. 4 of the amendment to title 39, United States Code includes technical and conforming amendments related to annual budget, comprehensive plan references, and chapter analysis.
